text: I keep finding legit tasks for "ChatGPT". For example, I have a new utility that hooks Chokidar up to websockets. If a file is modified, a message goes to a server, which in turn forwards the message to N listeners. Chokidar is a very nice utility with lots of configuration options, but sparse docs. I wanted to know if there was anything I could do to improve latency, ie the time it takes for a change to a file to be noticed and acted on. The docs provide some vague clues, but when I asked ChatGPT if I could adjust the latency, it gave me a clear yes, and showed me how to do it. Also suggested there might be lesser-known toolkits that would be better for this kind of application.
